item.title: Supreme Court strikes down affirmative action in college admissions
item.description: - The Supreme Court has struck down affirmative action policies at colleges and universities that use race as a factor in admissions decisions, ruling that they are illegally discriminating based on race and violating the 14th Amendment of the Constitution.

item.title: Valve is not willing to publish games with AI generated content anymore?
item.description: - Valve is no longer willing to publish games that contain AI-generated content, citing potential legal issues related to intellectual property rights.

item.title: The Awk Programming Language, Second Edition
item.description: - The second edition of "The AWK Programming Language" is soon to be released, reflecting the changes in the Awk language and the computing world since the first edition in 1988.

item.title: CLI tools hidden in the Python standard library
item.description: - The Python standard library contains hidden CLI tools that can be accessed directly from the terminal using the `python -m` command.

item.title: Kagi raises $670k
item.description: - Kagi has raised $670K in a SAFE note investment round, their first external fundraise so far, with the support of 42 accredited investors, many of whom are Kagi users.

item.title: Monster gravitational waves spotted for first time
item.description: - Researchers have used pulsars, beacon stars in the Galactic neighborhood, to detect monster gravitational waves for the first time.

item.title: Aspartame sweetener to be declared possible cancer risk by WHO, say reports
item.description: - The World Health Organization's cancer research arm is reportedly preparing to declare aspartame, an artificial sweetener used in thousands of products, as a "possible carcinogenic to humans."

item.title: Bill C-18: Google to remove news links in Canada over online news law
item.description: - Google is removing news links in Canada due to a new online news law called Bill C-18.

item.title: Github.com is down
item.description: - GitHub, a popular platform for hosting and collaborating on software projects, experienced a temporary outage.

item.title: Programming languages going above & beyond
item.description: - The author discusses the limitations of existing programming languages and highlights the potential for improvement in programming languages.
